properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting around the road closures. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to visit the annual Crows Nest Fest on Willoughby Rd from 10am to 5pm.

Willoughby Rd will be closed between Falcon St and Albany St from 12:01am until 11pm Sunday.

Other local roads joining Willoughby Rd will also be closed including sections of Burlington St, Clarke St, Holtermann St, Hume Ln and Willoughby Ln.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as delays are expected on roads in the area including Ernest St, Falcon St, Chandos St and the Pacific Hwy

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Granny Smith Festival, running from 9am until 8:30pm. The event will be held along Rowe Street, Progress Avenue and Hillview Road from 9am to 3.30pm, Eastwood Plaza from 9am to 5.30pm and Eastwood Oval from 9am to 8.30pm, with fireworks at 8pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic in the area will be heavier than usual while closures and local traffic detours are in place.

Local roads will close between 5pm Friday and 10pm Saturday including sections of Rowe St, Trelawney St, Progress Ave, Hillview Rd, Lakeside Rd, Shaftsbury Rd, Glen St and Richards Ave.

Motorists should also exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct as basketball fans travel to and from the game.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking to secure a space. Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book available until 11.59pm the night before the event.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

AFC Cup: Central Coast Mariners v Stallion Laguna FC at Industree Group Stadium in Gosford. Kick-off from 7pm, full time around 9pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed before the match between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Route 526 and 533 buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 1,500 people are expected to participate in the annual Billbergia Bennelong Bridge Run from 7:15am to 10am. Changed traffic conditions including road closures will be in place.

Motorists travelling around Rhodes, Wentworth Point and Olympic Park should allow additional travel time, follow diversions and directions of traffic controllers and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Road closures:

  • 5am to 11am: Wentworth Pl between Burroway Rd and Footbridge Boulevarde
  • 5am to 10am: Bennelong Bridge between Shoreline Dr and Waterways St and sections of Waterways St, Wentworth St, Wentworth Pl and Shoreline Dr will close. Lane closures will also be in place on sections of Jamieson St and Holker St. 
  • 5am to 9am: sections of Hill Rd from Wentworth Point to Olympic Park, Kevin Coombs Ave and the Holker Busway will close.

Stop/slow traffic control will be in place between 5am and 10am and the intersection of Hill Rd and Footbridge Boulevarde, and Jamieson St between Holker St and the shared pathway.

Night at the Barracks is back on Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights at The Barracks Precinct from 15 September to 7 October.

Traffic maybe heavier than usual on event nights as attendees travel to and from the shows.

Limited parking is available nearby St Pauls High School on event nights. Motorists must pre-book a space as no casual parking will be available on the night.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of extra pedestrian activity in the area.

properties.otherAdvice: The Port Stephens Triathlon is taking place at One Mile Beach from 7:30am to 1pm. Road closures will be in place for the event from 6am until 1pm on sections of Gan Gan Rd, Frost Rd, Hannah Pde, Eucalyptus Dr, Melaleuca Dr and Casuarina Cl. Resident access will be maintained during the closures when there are safe breaks between cyclists. Traffic controllers will be on site to direct motorists.

properties.otherAdvice:
Australia Cup Final: Sydney FC v Brisbane Roar at Allianz Stadium. Kick-Off at 7:45pm, finish 9:30pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5.30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave. Access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd. EP2 will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
SXSW Sydney from 15-22 October in the Sydney CBD. A series of conferences, festivals, an expo and parties will take place at vaious times and locations across the Sydney CBD.

Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions will be in place on sections of Grafton Lane and Knox Street from Wednesday 18 to Sunday 22 October. Traffic will be diverted via Shepherd Street and Myrtle Street while closures are in place.

Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area and follow diversions while roads are closed.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle buses will run around course in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 15,000 participants will walk along a 28km circuit crossing seven iconic bridges in the annual 7 Bridges Walk event.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

From 7:30am to 4pm lane 1 eastbound of River Rd will be closed between Lane Cove Country Club driveway (Stevenson St) and Greenwich Hospital Pedestrian Crossing (St Vincents Rd).

Motorists should slow down, watch for pedestrians and exercise caution.

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle buses will run around course in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 15,000 participants will walk along a 28km circuit crossing seven iconic bridges in the annual 7 Bridges Walk event.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

From 5am to 4pm the following roads within Callan Park will be closed:

  • Wharf Rd at Military Dr
  • Central Ave between Military Dr and North Crescent/Waterfront Dr
  • Military Dr between Wharf Rd and Central Ave 
  • North Crescent from Park Dr

From 6am to 6pm Durham St between Church St and Heath Ave, and Heath Ave from Durham St will be closed. Managed access will be maintained for local residents.

KISS: The Final Curtain at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Support acts start from 5.15pm. Show finishes around 11pm.

With more than 40,000 fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct as attendees travel to the event.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking to secure a space. Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book available until 11.59pm the night before the event.

properties.publicTransport: Buses will run frequently between the city, Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Buses will be in high demand so allow extra travel time. Avoid the largest crowds by visiting on a weekday instead. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sculpture by the Sea exhibition returns to the Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk for 18 days from Friday 20 October to Monday 6 November. Changed traffic conditions and parking restrictions will be in place.

With up to 500,000 people expected to visit throughout the exhibition significant delays are expected on roads approaching Bondi and Tamarama beaches including Bondi Road, Old South Head Road and Syd Einfeld Drive approaching Bondi Beach. 

Motorists avoid driving through the area where possible or expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time, particularly on weekends.

Road closures and changed traffic conditions

  • Local roads will be closed from 7:30am to 6:30pm daily in Bronte, Bondi and Tamarama including sections of Notts Ave, Fletcher St, Marks Ln, Kenneth St, Bayview St, Wolaroi Cr, Ashley St, Turner St, Cross St, Birrell St, Darling St, Silva St, Illawong Ave, Carlisle St, Rowland Ave and Wilga St. Access for residents will be maintained.
  • One-way traffic conditions will be in place around the coastal walk for the duration of the event from 9am Friday 20 October until 10am Monday 6 November. Allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers and exercise caution.

Special event clearways

Strict parking restrictions will be in effect each weekend of the event on Saturday 21 and Sunday 22 October, Saturday 28 and Sunday 29 October, and Saturday 4 and Sunday 5 November at the following times and locations:

  • 7am to 2pm: Bondi Rd from Oxford St at Bondi Junction to Sandridge St at Bondi Beach (northern side)
  • 12pm midday to 8pm: Bondi Rd from Sandridge St at Bondi Beach to Oxford St at Bondi Junction (southern side)
  • 8am to 4pm: Campbell Pde between Queen Elizabeth Drive and Beach Rd at Bondi Beach (southern side)

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney - Sydney Streets event on Glebe Point Rd. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.

  • Glebe Point Rd will be closed between Broadway and St Johns Rd from 9am to 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Norton St, Mitchell St, Cowper St, Derwent Ln, Derby Pl and Francis St will also be closed during this time.
  • Motorists can detour around the closures via St Johns Rd and Derwent St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Glebe Point Rd, Francis St, Derby Pl, Cowper St, Norton St and Mitchell St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included for ticketholders. Light rail services run regularly to Royal Randwick on the L2 Line or to Kensington on the L3 Line. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Everest Day – Everest Carnival at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 12:30pm, last race at 6:10pm followed by a concert from 6.20pm.

With up to 40,000 attendees expected traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the racecourse including Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

After the race day, traffic will be heavy in the area as A-League fans travel to Moore Park for the women’s Sydney Derby.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: L1 light rail services run regularly to stops at Darling Harbour. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
South by Southwest (SXSW) Sydney Festival from Sunday 15 to Sunday 22 October. Various conference and expo events will be held at venues in Darling Harbour including Tumbalong Park, the International Convention Centre and Aware Super Theatre.

Allow extra travel time on roads in the city and Pyrmont around Darling Harbour as traffic may be heavier than usual before and after events.

Motorists should exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Delays are expected on major roads approaching Bathurst including the M4 Mwy, Great Western Hwy and Bells Line of Rd from Sydney, Mitchell Hwy from Orange, Mid Western Hwy from Cowra and Castlereagh Hwy from Mudgee.

Traffic controllers will be on-site on local roads to manage access to and from the Mount Panorama precinct.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time over the weekend and expect delays on Monday 9 October as fans head home from Bathurst.

_____________________________

VICTORIA PASS - Monday 9 October

Traffic is expected to be heavy along the Great Western Highway from Bathurst towards Sydney, with significant eastbound delays expected at Blackheath in the Blue Mountains. Reduced speed zones will be in place on the Great Western Highway at Mount Victoria, with queing expected.

In the event of eastbound traffic queues extending from Blackheath to Mount Victoria, traffic management will be in place at the bottom of Victoria Pass on Great Western Highway, Little Hartley. Traffic will be held at this location to avoid breakdowns resulting from queuing on Victoria Pass, and to ensure the safe passage of motorists up the Pass. 

_______________________________

COWRA - Monday 9 October

Reduced speed zones will be in place on the Mid Western Hwy in Cowra with delays and queuing expected.
The NESCC Metz Gorge Rallysprint will be held on Sunday 1 October from 7am to 7pm at Echidna Gully.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Express trains and major event buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL & NRLW Grand Final at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Gates open from 1pm with preliminary matches from 1:20pm. Knights v Titans NRL Women's Grand Final kick-off at 3:55pm, followed by the Panthers v Broncos NRL Grand Final kicking off at 7:30pm, with full time around 9:30pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the precinct as up to 80,000 fans travel to the stadium for the match.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the game between 7pm Saturday 30 Oct and 3am Monday 2 Oct. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the NRL Grand Final live site being held at Panthers Leagues Club.

From 8.30pm approximately, closures will be in place on roads around the venue and intersections will be managed by traffic controllers and NSW Police. Pedestrian crossings will also be managed by traffic control. Access to Retreat Dr for residents will be maintained.

There will be no right turn permitted from Ransley St onto Mulgoa Rd from 8.30pm.

The Leagues Club car park will close once capacity is reached.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of personnel on site.

Exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 10,000 people per day are expected to attend the 51st annual NSW Aboriginal Rugby League Koori Knockout tournament from Friday to Monday, 8am to 6pm daily.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on the Pacific Hwy, Wyong Rd, Bryant Dr and Pacific Mwy, as crowds travel to and from the event.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in Tuggerah.
properties.displayName: NSW Aboriginal Rugby League Koori Knockout

roads.mainStreet: Central Coast Regional Sporting & Recreation Complex

webLinks.linkText: NSW National Parks & Wildlife Service - Royal National Park local alerts

properties.headline: Royal National Park - October long weekend holiday period ROYAL NATIONAL PARK McKell Avenue, Farnell Avenue
properties.otherAdvice:
The Royal National Park is expected to be busy over the October long weekend.

Road closures will be implemented as precincts and car parks reach full at Wattamolla Beach, Maianbar, and Bundeena.

If parking capacity is reached across all precincts, traffic will only be permitted to travel through the park.

If there are significant delays, both the northern and southern entries to the park, via Farnell Ave at Loftus and via Lady Wakehurst Dr at Otford, will close. Entry will be maintained via McKell Ave at Waterfall for residents only. 

Visitors are encouraged to check the Royal National Park local alerts before travelling for updates on precinct access. Walking trails may also be closed due to fire bans and/or risks so plan ahead. 

Road closures when precincts reach capacity:

  • Wattamolla Rd between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Wattamolla Beach is now closed.
  • Maianbar Rd between Bundeena Dr and Maianbar township.
  • Bundeena Dr between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Bundeena township.

Traffic controllers and NSW Police will manage access for local residents, upon proof of address, at Maianbar Rd and Bundeena Dr.

Note - Garie Rd remains closed from Sir Bertram Stevens Dr due to road damage.
properties.displayName: Royal National Park - October long weekend holiday period
